abstract: First, it was Goldman Sachs that set the pace among the TARP-laden financial companies. Back in November, the firm moved to grab the headlines by announcing the top players would not be awarded their bonuses, a decision that was then repeated throughout most of the banking world.
lead_paragraph: First, it was Goldman Sachs that set the pace among the TARP-laden financial companies. Back in November, the firm moved to grab the headlines by announcing the top players would not be awarded their bonuses, a decision that was then repeated throughout most of the banking world.

headline.main: Will a Whisper From G.E. Start a No-Bonus Stampede?
